snippet.title: Smithsonian Museum Raises $170,000 for Yoga History Exhibit
snippet.description:
Smithsonian Museum Raises $170,000 for Yoga History Exhibit
Toegevoegd door Geo Beats laatste juli
The Smithsonian Museum will open a special exhibit that showcases the history of yoga, and they asked for donations to make it happen. They raised 170 thousand dollars, which exceeded their goal of 125 thousand dollars.The Smithsonian Museum will open a special exhibit that showcases the history of yoga, and they used crowd-funding to make it happen. It is the first exhibit to use this kind of online fundraising campaign. Allison Peck, head of public affairs and marketing at the Smithsonian galleries where the exhibit will be held said:: “I know that the eyes of the museum world have been on us as we try this, especially the larger art museums, to see if something they could attempt…in the next few months we'll do a lot of analysis about what we can take from this in terms of how we reach out to people in fundraising, and whether it's something we could try again.” They raised 170 thousand dollars, (1,headline) which exceeded their goal of 125 thousand dollars. Over 600 donors gave money, including Whole Foods, which donated 70 thousand dollars. The exhibit will open at the Freer and Sackler galleries of the Smithsonian during October of this year. Yoga has recently been accepted by mainstream popular American culture, but it has been around for thousands of years, and has a long history in a variety of cultures.
133 views

snippet.title: Yoga History & Philosophy – Rachel Tsai – Absolute Yoga
snippet.description:
Yoga History & Philosophy – Rachel Tsai – Absolute Yoga
Toegevoegd door Lucas Rockwood 2 jaren geleden
http://www.TeachHotYoga.com – Teach Hot Yoga, Inspire Students, Change Lives… 200 Hour Yoga Alliance Yoga Teacher Certification Course in Thailand.ABOUT RACHEL TSAI - Rachel has been studying the great tradition of yoga for over a decade both in and outside India. She currently teaches courses and workshops in yoga philosophy, Ayurveda and Sanskrit. She is an Ayurvedic clinical practitioner, with qualification in both Ayurveda and Yoga (Therapy). She has an ongoing advanced study in Sanskrit as well as in Vedic and Western astrology. With gratitude and faith, Rachel draws inspiration form the practice of Ashtanga Vinyasa Yoga system as taught by the late great teacher Sri K Pattabhi Jois in Mysore, India. She is Yoga Alliance 500 hr qualified. Please refer to www.matipatha.com for more information.MORE INFORMATION? http://www.TeachHotYoga.com
170 views

snippet.title: Archetypes & History: Sat Yoga Costa Rica
snippet.description:
Archetypes & History: Sat Yoga Costa Rica
Toegevoegd door satyogainstitute 4 jaren geleden
http://satyogainstitute.org/ Student Question: In the seminar last weekend you said that archetypes are the ones that are running history and our lives. Can you give a little more information on that? "Well at a certain moment in history there was a choice made, not at a conscious but at a super-conscious level . . . within not only the human species but within the realm of all the actants—no longer to support the dharma. And the dharma then—at an archetypal level—recognized that it must go into exile. And the world was then run by false powers," explains Shunyamurti, the spiritual director of the Sat Yoga Institute in Costa Rica. And it is only through the archetypes—not through any individual ego—that the dharma will return. And it is at this moment in history—when all love seems to have disappeared from the planet—that it must and will return.
70 views
